title: Update regarding Nexus Software
story_body:
Nexus Software (NXS) has announced several internal promotions, with Rachel Lee taking on the role of Senior Engineering Manager, overseeing the development of the company's flagship product, NexusCore. Lee, a 10-year veteran of the company, has been instrumental in driving the adoption of agile methodologies and containerization using Docker.

In marketing news, NXS has launched a refreshed website, featuring a revamped documentation section with improved API references and code samples. The new site also showcases the company's commitment to environmental sustainability, with a dedicated ESG section highlighting its efforts to reduce carbon emissions through data center consolidation and renewable energy sourcing.

On the ESG front, NXS has set a goal to achieve 100% renewable energy powering its data centers by 2025, in line with the Science-Based Targets initiative (SBTi). The company has also implemented a comprehensive diversity and inclusion program, aimed at increasing underrepresented groups in its workforce by 20% over the next 18 months.

In a statement, NXS said, "These updates reflect our ongoing commitment to driving innovation, sustainability, and inclusivity in everything we do." The company will continue to provide regular updates on its progress towards these goals.

Meanwhile, the latest NexusCore benchmarks show improved performance on AMD EPYC 7002 series processors, with up to 25% increase in throughput on select workloads. The company has also released a new version of its NexusOptimizer tool, featuring enhanced support for NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs and Intel Optane DC persistent memory.
